title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
description: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there are no children nodes listed.
OB: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
EB: Children nodes should be listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. Ensure that the new data source has no database/table/column information.
3. Open the data set editor for the created data set.
4. Try to change the data source.
5. Observe that there are no children nodes listed.
6. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
7. Verify that the children nodes are still not listed.
